formattedAddress: 115 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 115 Allen St, New York, NY 10002-2970, USA

editorialSummary.text: Trendy, snug cocktail bar serving finger foods, chicken sandwiches & creative drinks.

originalText.text:
I’ve been to many bars around the world, and Double Chicken Please is one of my favorites. I love it so much that I come about once a month.

My personal favorites are the Waldorf Salad, which is a light celery-ginger-walnut highball, and the Red Eye Gravy which is a spirit forward, butter-washed, coffee and mushroom infused old fashioned type drink. I like to end with one of the dessert drinks - the Key Lime Pie or the French Toast. Usually, I order the popcorn chicken with the basil aioli as well. Hot take, but I prefer the popcorn chicken over the sandwiches.

If you’re looking for something easy to drink, I recommend the Key Lime Pie, French Toast, and the Japanese Cold Noodle. I can barely tell there is alcohol in these.

If you wanna try something different, I’d recommend the Cold Pizza or Red Eye Gravy. Both are inspired by savory dishes and I think it’s incredible how they created these flavors.

I will say that if you’re not open to new flavors or experiences and your favorite cocktail is something familiar this is not the place for you. I’ve made the mistake of recommending DCP to people who only wanted classic drinks without any changes. But if you are, I promise it will be unlike most cocktail bars you’ve experienced.

text.text:

originalText.text:
Great experience. Showed up solo at 3:50pm and waited until 5pm, they gave me the first bar seat in The coop backroom. Line grew really long after 4:20pm. This was January so I imagine its even longer sooner in warmer weather. Seating was limited to 90 minutes. Again, this is the backroom with the craft cocktails. The front room is no craft cocktails but food and beer and that had space for walk ins.

Loved the interior, the bar, food, and drink. Had the salted egg yolk chicken, the Bolognese grilled cheese, and 3 cocktails - red eye gravy, raisin biscuit, and the french toast. These were the sweeter desert style drinks, but they had savory and classic drinks too that sounded interesting enough to plan to come back to. Service was incredibly quick possibly because I was the first inside but everyone seemed to get their food right away around me. The pricing was really great in my opinion for a place like this. The food in particular was almost all under $20. Craft cocktails were roughly $20 each which was expected, but for the quality it was worth it.

originalText.text:
Fantastic! Both the food and drinks are very expensive, but only slightly above Manhattan prices (maybe even standard).

There was a long wait outside and then another wait inside for the Coop. The first time we went, we make it to the Coop (only the front queue), but this visit, we did and it actually felt worth the wait!! The Key Lime Lime Cocktail alone made it worthwhile.

The atmosphere was great and you notice an immediate shift from the front desk vs the Coop. Definitely recommend and can see why this place is #2 cocktail in the world! Would definitely recommend securing a reservation though.

originalText.text: The cocktails disappointed, I have tried many of the top bars in different cities and I expected more. The presentations were very basic, the flavors/taste flat and often not matching what I would expect from the description. I tried 3 different ones to make sure. Food was good, classic fried chicken sandwich but well done

The presentations were very basic, the flavors/taste flat and often not matching what I would expect from the description. I tried 3 different ones to make sure. originalText.text:
The space is dark and not very comfortable and if you try to walk in, you can expect a wait time of a few hours but it's all worth it - they have some of the most tasty chicken in town.

Great spices and a nice crisp batter. The chicken is tender and the bread used for the sandwich is soft and buttery.

The popcorn chicken and hot honey chicken sandwich are the things to order
